title: Asset Management Firms' Market Share
text:
"Over the last decade, the largest asset managers have gotten bigger and more powerful.

Just five — Vanguard, BlackRock, Fidelity Investments, American Funds, and T. Rowe Price

— control 55% of the $19.3 trillion in total assets of U.S. mutual funds and exchange-traded funds."

"A deeper dive into the data shows that competition in the U.S. asset management industry

remains healthy. According to research done by Morningstar Direct for Institutional Investor,

the top five active managers controlled only 22% of mutual fund and ETF assets as of the end

of 2018. These figures have been fairly steady for at least the last five years.

That’s a far cry from the 55% run by the top five when both active and passive are included."
